item.title: Changeset [1467]: Remove extra slashes from link name and link description.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Remove extra slashes from link name and link description.

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: millette
item.description: Recently, geourl removed it's trackback - which was still there for wordpress to find just yesterday. In my case, I noticed since editing drafts took a whole minute, my php timeout value. I tracked the problem to geourl, but there's actually a flow in the logic around that code. Nothing should get pinged as I'm editing a draft. Geourl shed some light on that problem, we have to take care of the source, not only the symptom.

item.title: Ticket #137 (Comments feed modification time is based on posts, not comments) updated
item.dc:creator: kelson
item.description: The function hugo posted seems to work. I added it and changed the call in wp-blog-header.php on the 2nd, and it's been working fine since then. It even handles the case where I go in and edit a recent comment.

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Check the GeoURL site. It says "We are down for renovations. Check back soon!"

So the problem may be on the GeoURL side.

item.title: Ticket #165 (Per-post filters) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I agree. The one thing that is screwing up my blog is how I have used textile 1.0 in some places, HTML in others and now textile 2.0.

Old posts get screwed up every now and then, and I need to find a solution to deal with the maintaince! Per post is one way. Straight up conversion to HTML I think is also another...

item.title: Ticket #164 (If using GeoURL, can't update posts) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I am trying to post now, and I have this error:

Warning: fsockopen(): unable to connect to geourl.org:80 in /usr/share/wordpress/wp-includes/functions.php on line 870

Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /usr/share/wordpress/wp-includes/functions.php:870) in /usr/share/wordpress/wp-admin/post.php on line 340

BLOCKING my post! :(

item.title: Ticket #171 (Lat/Lon input fields not closed) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan

item.title: Changeset [1465]: Close post_latf and post_lonf input tags. ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Close post_latf and post_lonf input tags. ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/bug_view_page.php?bug_id=0000171

item.title: Ticket #172 (Show number of comments in queue) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
[From emeyer] It would also be helpful to have the number of comments in the queue appear in the masthead of all wp-admin pages. Following is the hack I wrote; note that it assumes that the currently logged-in person can moderate all comments (true for me, but not for some). It also uses inline styles to override CSS in the wp-admin.css file, which I didn't feel like hacking in addition. I would recommend moving the inline styles into wp-admin.css and testing on multiple browsers.

<div id="wphead" style="position: relative;"> <h1><a href="​http://wordpress.org" rel="external" title="<?php _e('Visit WordPress.org') ?>"><?php _e('WordPress') ?></a></h1> <p id="modqueue" style="position: absolute; bottom: 0.66em; right: 0.5em; margin: 0;"> <?php $comments = $wpdb->get_results("SELECT * FROM $tablecomments WHERE comment_approved = '0'"); echo '<a href="'. get_settings('siteurl') .'/wp-admin/moderation.php" style="display: inline;">Awaiting Moderation: ' . count($comments) . '</a>'; ?></p> </div>

item.title: Ticket #172 (Show number of comments in queue) created
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: On the menu it should show the number of comments the logged in author can moderate in the menu, like "Awaiting Moderation (3)".

item.title: Ticket #171 (Lat/Lon input fields not closed) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: The Latitude and Longitude input fields that appear when displaying post.php are not closed and cause the page not to be valid XHTML.

item.title: Ticket #170 ("For" attribute of long/lat fields points to non-existant IDs) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
The "for" attribute of the logitude and latitude fields on post.php do not point to elements with a valid ID.

The logitude and latitude input areas need to have their ID attributes set to the same as their names.

item.title: Ticket #154 (Can't future date a draft) updated
item.dc:creator: rmanalan
item.description: To reproduce it, future date a draft post then save it as a draft (don't publish it).

item.title: Ticket #154 (Can't future date a draft) updated
item.dc:creator: matt

item.dc:creator: matt

Fixed. Didn't use your exact patch but thanks for pointing out where the problem was!
